channel.title: sendMessage VS. sM
channel.description: If what file (EX: Client.java) would I find where the sendMessage (command I guess) is coded? Mine is set so you have to type sM but I want it to be sendMessage. Or is that just a waste of my time?

item.title: sendMessage VS. sM
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“JaydenD12, post:15, topic:341513”][quote author=LilXCj link=topic=437911.msg3218282#msg3218282 date=1274914973]

public void sM(string s) {

to

public void sendMessage(string s) {

Your a genius, what would we do without you?

It’s called helping.

Ok, just so you know your help has an error in it ;D

HOW MANY?!

“an” implies one.

I know. But when it comes to errors, you know it can be 100 errors.

I know I didn’t capitalize String, but he should figure that out.

“100 errors” is not a real error…
Though you would get 100 errors compiling that because you changed the name of a method that is called well over 100 times.

ctrl + h
Find: sM
Replace: sendMessage

PROBLEM FIXED
[/quote]

Or you could be smart and download notepad++, which has a built in feature called “Replace in files”.[/quote]

Cause notepad++ > notepad!

Read full topic

Or you could be smart and download notepad++, which has a built in feature called “Replace in files”.
